paragraphs.text: %md ## OML4R Data Cleaning: fill in missing data In this notebook, we demonstrate how to perform missing value replacement using OML4R. We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance. The dataset `CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_R` is generated by the `"OML Run-me-first"` notebook, which `MUST` be run before this notebook. --- ##### `IMPORTANT`: The `"OML Run-me-first"` notebook is available under the menu Templates -> Examples and is a pre-requisite to the current notebook. --- **Note**: when building or applying a model using in-database Oracle Machine Learning algorithms, this operation may *not* be needed separately if automatic data preparation is enabled. Automatic data preparation automatically replaces missing values of numerical attributes with the mean and missing values of categorical attributes with the mode. For example, see Data Preparation for GLM Copyright (c) 2022 Oracle Corporation ###### The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0 --- Import R libraries and obtain a proxy object to the data table. To use OML4R, first import the library ORE. Users can get online help using R's help function and specifying the function of interest.

msg.data:
OML4R Data Cleaning: fill in missing data

In this notebook, we demonstrate how to perform missing value replacement using OML4R.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

The dataset CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_R is generated by the "OML Run-me-first" notebook, which MUST be run before this notebook.

IMPORTANT: The "OML Run-me-first" notebook is available under the menu Templates -> Examples and is a pre-requisite to the current notebook.

Note: when building or applying a model using in-database Oracle Machine Learning algorithms, this operation may not be needed separately if automatic data preparation is enabled. Automatic data preparation automatically replaces missing values of numerical attributes with the mean and missing values of categorical attributes with the mode. For example, see Data Preparation for GLM

Copyright (c) 2022 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

Import R libraries and obtain a proxy object to the data table.
To use OML4R, first import the library ORE.
Users can get online help using R's help function and specifying the function of interest.

paragraphs.title: Get proxy object for CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_R table and view a few rows
paragraphs.text:
%r

ore.sync(table = 'CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_R', use.keys= FALSE)
ore.attach()

CUST_DF <- CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_R

z.show(head(CUST_DF))

paragraphs.title: REPLACE NA with ‘SINGLE’  for MARITAL_STATUS and missing numericals with the mean
paragraphs.text:
%r

MISS_VAL$MARITAL_STATUS[is.na(MISS_VAL$MARITAL_STATUS)] <- "SINGLE"

MISS_VAL$CREDIT_BALANCE[is.na(MISS_VAL$CREDIT_BALANCE)] <- round(mean(MISS_VAL$CREDIT_BALANCE, na.rm = TRUE),2)
MISS_VAL$BANK_FUNDS[is.na(MISS_VAL$BANK_FUNDS)] <- round(mean(MISS_VAL$BANK_FUNDS, na.rm = TRUE),2)
MISS_VAL$INCOME[is.na(MISS_VAL$INCOME)] <- round(mean(MISS_VAL$INCOME, na.rm = TRUE),2)
